name: find-it-faster
description: Find it, but faster! Leveraging fzf and rg.

commands.title: Find It Faster: search within files

find-it-faster.general.hideTerminalAfter.markdownDescription: Extensions have limited control over the terminal panel. Ideally, it would be possible to automatically switch back to the previous thing you were doing (e.g. hide the terminal, show the terminal you're working on, show the tasks panel if that's what you were on), but we can't. Select here whether you want the terminal to be hidden or remain shown after invoking a command that fails / is canceled.

Extensions have limited control over the terminal panel. Ideally, it would be possible to automatically switch back to the previous thing you were doing (e.g. hide the terminal, show the terminal you're working on, show the tasks panel if that's what you were on), but we can't. Select here whether you want the terminal to be hidden or remain shown after invoking a command that succeeds.

find-it-faster.general.clearTerminalAfte.markdownDescription: Sends a 'clear' command after invoking a terminal command for a cleaner look

find-it-faster.general.showMaximizedTerm.markdownDescription: Show the terminal in full screen. Works especially nicely if you set the "hide after succes / fail" options in these preferences.

find-it-faster.general.defaultSearchLoca.markdownDescription: Search in this folder if you don't have any folders added to your workspace

find-it-faster.findFiles.previewCommand.markdownDescription: Command that is used by `fzf` to produce the preview. Use `{}` to indicate the filename. Example: `cat {}`. Recommendation: install `bat` and have code highlighting using e.g. `bat --force-colorization --theme='1337' --plain {}`! This option does not do anything if previews are turned off.

find-it-faster.findFiles.previewWindowCo.markdownDescription: Used by `fzf` to determine position and look of the preview window. See the `fzf` documentation. Example for a horizontal split: `top,50%,border-bottom`

find-it-faster.findWithinFiles.previewCo.markdownDescription: Command that is used by `fzf` to produce the preview when searching within files. Use `{1}` to indicate the filename, `{2}` for the line number. **Note**: setting is ignored when `fzf --version` < 0.26.

find-it-faster.findWithinFiles.previewWi.markdownDescription: Used by `fzf` to determine position and look of the preview window. See the `fzf` documentation. Example for a horizontal split: `top,50%,border-bottom,+{2}+3/3,~3`, **Note**: setting is ignored when `fzf --version` < 0.26.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
